Class Outstate

  • java.lang.Object
    • Student
      • Outstate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public class Outstate
extends Student
    The Outstate class defines the properties and methods of an outstate student and extends the Student class. Outstate students have a first name, last name, the number of credits they take and they can be from tri-state area or not. Students can print info and calculate tuition due.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Outstate

        public Outstate(java.lang.String fname,
                java.lang.String lname,
                int credit,
                boolean isTriState)
        This is the Outstate constructor. Takes in a string first name, last name, an int of number of credits, and a boolean that indicates if they are from Tri-state.
        Parameters:
        fname - The student first name.
        lname - The student last name.
        credit - Number of credits taken by student.
        isTriState - True or False.

    • Method Detail

      • tuitionDue

        public int tuitionDue()
        The tuitionDue method calculates the tuition due of a student. Calculation is based on the number of credits and if student getting a tri-state discount.
        Specified by:
        tuitionDue in class Student
        Returns:
        an integer which is the final tuition due in dollars.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string with fname, lname and credit hours with the tuition due.

        Returns:
